intro: Oncostemum macrocarpum var. hexamerum, commonly known as the six-lobed oncostemum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that typically display a range of colors from pink to red. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a notable ornamental plant in horticulture.
